secret_rule: Only items that have a scientific name in Latin can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Malus domestica" and "Fragaria × ananassa".
I will make a new guess. Can I bring "Rubus idaeus"?
I will make a new guess. Can I bring "Citrus × limon"?
I will make a new guess. Can I bring "Vitis vinifera"?
Player: I will make a new guess. Can I bring "Pyrus communis"?

Based on the examples and the items you've guessed, the rule appears to be that you can bring any plant or species name of cultivated fruit-bearing plants, specifically those in the botanical nomenclature following the format of "Genus species" or "Genus × species". All the examples provided, including "Malus domestica", "Fragaria × ananassa", "Rubus idaeus", "Citrus × limon", "Vitis vinifera", and "Pyrus communis", fit this category as they all refer to specific cultivated fruits. 

Therefore, my guess is that the rule is: **You can bring the scientific names of cultivated fruit plants.**
